    Creating digital citations for physical notes

    My obsession with QR codes has gone to another extreme

    The Problem

    A few weeks ago I started a Bullet Journal and got hooked instantly. The only problem I had was that if I am using a website, video or other digital tool how do I include it in the journal?

    There are a number of options that I could think of but each one had pretty major drawbacks:

    1. Write the URL
      I am not writing out URLs and then Typing them again if I need them in the future
    2. Use a URL Shortener
      Still have to type a URL in the future it is just shorter, and I have to hope that the service remains active or create my own URL shortener and support that long term
    3. Use Bookmarks in Browser and reference them
      This may work for some people but I am not a bookmark person, and I use multiple devices and browsers which are not all synchronized
    4. Use a digital notetaking app and cross reference both ways
      Again could work for some people but I don't want to have to use another app on multiple devices and to have to open it and find the right reference when trying to find things in the future.
    5. Bookmarking Apps
      Similar to the above two issues plus a whole other app just for bookmarks

    What I Wanted

    1. Create
